i1.name: Duelist's Dance
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Fiora''' identifies the {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} of nearby {{tip|sight|visible}} enemy champions, marked as an arc around themselves. {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} take {{fd|1.75}} seconds to become targetable and linger for {{fd|13.25}} seconds afterwards while '''Fiora''' remains near the target, otherwise the {{as|Vital|buzzword}} will disappear. After a {{as|Vital|buzzword}} ends, '''Fiora''' identifies a new one on her target.

'''Fiora's''' damage against a {{as|Vital|buzzword}} will trigger it to deal {{as|{{fd|3}}% {{as|(+ {{fd|5.5}}% per 100 '''bonus''' AD)}} of target's '''maximum''' health}} {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' true damage}}}}, {{tip|heal}} '''Fiora''' for {{pp|40 to 115}} and grant her {{pp|type=[[File:Grand Challenge.png|20px|link=]] Grand Challenge's Rank|key=%|20 to 50 for 4|0 to 3|formula=20%+(10%*Grand Challenge's Rank)|color=ms}} {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} that decays over {{fd|1.5}} seconds.
i1.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Fiora identifies the Vitals of nearby visible enemy champions, marked as an arc around themselves. Vitals take 1.75 seconds to become targetable and linger for 13.25 seconds afterwards while Fiora remains near the target, otherwise the Vital will disappear. After a Vital ends, Fiora identifies a new one on her target.
Fiora's damage against a Vital will trigger it to deal 3% (+ 5.5% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health bonus true damage, heal Fiora for 40undefined − 115undefined (based on level) and grant her 0 to 3 ‒ undefined bonus movement speed that decays over 1.5 seconds.
i1.notes:
* {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} can be triggered by any source of damage '''Fiora''' deals, except those with {{tip|default damage}} and {{tip|reactive damage}} types.
* The {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} are visible to all units.
* A {{as|Vital's|buzzword}} angle is fixed to the champion's model and doesn't interact with its orientation.
* {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} will not trigger if the attack is {{tip|dodge|dodged}}, {{tip|block|blocked}}, or missed while '''Fiora''' is {{tip|blind|blinded}}.
** {{Pending for test}}: {{ai|Lunge|Fiora}} interaction.

q1.name: Lunge
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Fiora''' {{tip|dashes}} a short distance in the target direction and then stabs a nearby enemy. ''Lunge'' can hit [[structures]] and {{tip|ward|wards}}. Stabbing a target reduces ''Lunge's'' {{sti|cooldown}} by 50%.
The stab deals {{as|physical damage}} and applies {{tip|on-hit}} effects at 100% effectiveness.
'''Fiora''' can cast any of her abilities while {{tip|dash|dashing}}.
''Lunge hits enemies regardless of whether '''Fiora''' has {{tip|sight}} of them.''
q1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Fiora dashes a short distance in the target direction and then stabs a nearby enemy. Lunge can hit structures and wards. Stabbing a target reduces Lunge's cooldown by 50%.
The stab deals physical damage and applies on-hit effects at 100% effectiveness.
Fiora can cast any of her abilities while dashing.
Lunge hits enemies regardless of whether Fiora has sight of them.
q1.notes:
* ''Lunge'' deals {{tip|basic damage}}, but also triggers spell effects by dealing an additional 0 {{tip|spell damage}}.
** ''Lunge'' cannot {{tip|critically strike}}.
* ''Lunge'' does not apply [[on-attack]] effects apart from certain exceptions.
** It does apply {{nie|Energized}} as if it was an [[on-hit]] effect.
** It does not stack {{ii|Guinsoo's Rageblade}} nor trigger Phantom Hit.
* The stab prioritizes in order of:
** Enemy champion affected by {{ai|Grand Challenge|Fiora}}.
** {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} facing '''Fiora'''.
** Champions who would die to the strike.
** The nearest champion.
** Enemies that would die to the strike.
** The closest enemy.
** Structures
** Wards.
* ''Lunge'' will not attempt to strike [[jungle plants]].
* '''Fiora''' does not stab if the {{tip|dash}} is {{tip|interrupt|interrupted}}.
* '''Fiora''' cannot cast or buffer {{si|Flash}} during the dash.
** '''Fiora''' can cast {{ii|Hextech Rocketbelt}} during the dash, potentinally interrupting it based on the timing, preventing the stab if it does.
* The dash '''can''' pass through walls.
* Will land (priority order unchanged) even if '''Fiora''' dies.
* ''Lunge's'' dash speed is affected by movement speed.

w1.name: Riposte
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Fiora''' enters a defensive stance for {{fd|0.75}} seconds, becoming {{tip|lockout|unable to act}} but preventing the application of all non-{{tip|turret}} damage to her and gaining {{tip|debuff}} immunity and {{tip|cc-immune|crowd control immunity}}.

Additionally, over the first {{fd|0.6}} seconds of the duration, '''Fiora''' poises to strike, after which she sends a shock with her sword in a line in the target direction, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to all enemies hit until colliding with an enemy champion.

The enemy champion struck is also {{tip|slow|slowed}} and {{tip|cripple|crippled}} by 50% for 2 seconds. If ''Riposte'' negates at least one {{tt|hostile|belonging to an enemy source}} {{tip|immobilize|immobilizing}} effect, '''Fiora''' {{tip|stun|stuns}} the target for the same duration instead.
w1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Fiora enters a defensive stance for 0.75 seconds, becoming unable to act but preventing the application of all non-turret damage to her and gaining debuff immunity and crowd control immunity.
Additionally, over the first 0.6 seconds of the duration, Fiora poises to strike, after which she sends a shock with her sword in a line in the target direction, dealing magic damage to all enemies hit until colliding with an enemy champion.
The enemy champion struck is also slowed and crippled by 50% for 2 seconds. If Riposte negates at least one hostile immobilizing effect, Fiora stuns the target for the same duration instead.
w1.notes:
* ''Riposte'' is not {{tip|invulnerability}} but instead reduces any damage to her by 100% late into the damage event. Because of this, it interacts differently with effects triggered from damage:
** {{stil|Life steal}} and {{tip|Heal|Healing}} based on damage dealt (Vamp) will still have effect even if the damage is ultimately ignored by ''Riposte''.
** {{tip|Shield|Shields}} will absorb damage before ''Riposte'' takes effect.
** '''Fiora''' cannot be {{tip|execute|executed}} by {{cai|Death from Below|Pyke}} during ''Riposte'' but she can by {{bi|Aspect of the Dragon}}.
* ''Riposte'' will not negate allied {{tip|crowd control}}.
* ''Riposte'' will not negate {{tip|nearsight}}.
* {{tip|Immobilize|Immobilizing}} effects include those from {{ui|Blast Cone}} (only if triggered by an enemy) and {{tip|monster|epic monsters}}.
* {{tip|Debuff}} immunity includes [[summoner spells]], such as {{si|Exhaust}} and {{si|Ignite}}, as well as [[damage over time]] and other effects.
* ''Riposte'' is and is not prioritized over certain effects:
** ''Riposte'' will block effects before {{tip|spell shield|spell shields}}.
** {{ai|Black Shield|Morgana}} will negate {{tip|crowd control}} before ''Riposte''.
*** ''Riposte'' will not be able to apply its {{tip|stun}}, as it requires ''Riposte'' to negate the {{tip|immobilize}} and not any other external source to do so.
* {{tip|Spell shield}} will also prevent {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} from being triggered by ''Riposte''.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Fiora''' is performing ''Riposte'':
{{ct|move=false|attack=false|cast=false|items=false|consume=false|spells=true,false,false,false|interrupts=death}}

e1.name: Bladework
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Fiora's''' next two [[basic attack]]s {{tip|on-attack}} within 4 seconds gain {{sti|range|25 '''bonus''' range}} and {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' attack speed}}}}.

The first attack {{tip|slow|slows}} the target by 30% for 1 second but cannot {{tip|critically strike}}. The second attack will {{tip|critically strike}} for {{sti|critical damage modifiers|{{as|'''modified''' critical damage}}}} (including to {{tip|turrets|structures}}).
e1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Fiora's next two basic attacks on-attack within 4 seconds gain 25 bonus range and bonus attack speed.
The first attack slows the target by 30% for 1 second but cannot critically strike. The second attack will critically strike for modified critical damage (including to structures).
Bladework resets Fiora's basic attack timer.
e1.notes:
* {{ii|Infinity Edge}} is not affected by the critical damage reduction and will increase the damage by 25% AD, instead of multiplying it by {{fd|112.5}}%.
* {{tip|Spell shield}} will only block the slow from the first hit.
* {{Pending for test}}: ''Bladework's'' interaction with {{tip|dodge|dodging}}, {{tip|block|blocking}}, and {{tip|blind|blinding}} effects.
e1.cooldown_warn: Wiki's and Riot's cooldowns do not match: Wiki's value '{{tt|{{ap|11 to 5}}|Starts post-effect}}' as '0/9/7/5/3/0' and riot's value '11,9.5,8,6.5,5' as '11/9.5/8/6.5/5'

r1.name: Grand Challenge
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Fiora''' challenges the target enemy champion for 8 seconds, highlighting all four of their {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} after a {{fd|0.5}}-second delay. While in effect, {{ai|Duelist's Dance|Fiora}} does not identify new {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} on '''Fiora's''' target.
While near the target, '''Fiora''' gains {{ais|Duelist's Dance|Fiora}} {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}}.

If '''Fiora''' triggers at least one {{as|Vital|buzzword}} before the target {{tip|death|dies}}, or triggers all four, she creates a {{ai|Grand Challenge 2|Fiora|''Victory Zone''}} at their location for {{pp|changedisplay=true|type=Vitals hit|2 to 5 for 4|color=buzzword}} seconds, which {{tip|heal|heals}} '''Fiora''' and all allies within the area every second.
''Unlike {{ai|Duelist's Dance|Fiora}}, the {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} will continue to linger even if '''Fiora''' is not nearby.''
r1.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Duelist's Dance's bonus movement speed is increased.
Active: Fiora challenges the target enemy champion for 8 seconds, highlighting all four of their Vitals after a 0.5-second delay. While in effect, Duelist's Dance does not identify new Vitals on Fiora's target.
While near the target, Fiora gains Duelist's Dance's bonus movement speed.
If Fiora triggers at least one Vital before the target dies, or triggers all four, she creates a Victory Zone at their location for 2undefined − 5 for 4undefined (based on level) seconds, which heals Fiora and all allies within the area every second.
Unlike Duelist's Dance, the Vitals will continue to linger even if Fiora is not nearby.
leveling: {{st|Heal per Tick|{{ap|80 to 140}} {{as|(+ 60% '''bonus''' AD)}}|Maximum Heal|{{ap|80*5 to 140*5}} {{as|(+ 300% '''bonus''' AD)}}}}
r1.notes:
* ''Grand Challenge'' is dispelled instantly if targeting a [[decoy]].
** {{Pending for test}}: {{cai|Glory in Death|Sion}}
* The damage of this ability scales with {{ai|Duelist's Dance|Fiora}}.
* Even if '''Fiora''' dies, the {{ai|Grand Challenge 2|Fiora|''Victory Zone''}} will trigger so long as she hit at least one {{as|Vital|buzzword}} and they die before the {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} wear off. 
** {{tip|Resurrection}} effects will not prevent the activation of the {{ai|Grand Challenge 2|Fiora|''Victory Zone''}}.
* Ally units in {{tip|stasis (buff)|stasis}} will not be {{tip|heal|healed}} by the {{ai|Grand Challenge 2|Fiora|Victory Zone}}.
* '''Fiora''' will automatically attack the target upon casting if the target was selected while they weren't in range of the ability.

effects.str:
• Heal per Tick: (+ 60% bonus AD)
  • Maximum Heal: (+ 300% bonus AD)
